summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York inquiring about the processing of electronic devices seized during the July 2019 search of Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence. The email notes that the taint team received fewer documents than expected and seeks clarification on the number of devices sent to and processed by CART (Computer Analysis and Response Team).

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: Author of the email, inquiring about the status and count of electronic devices seized from Epstein's New York residence and processed by CART.

events.title: Search of Epstein's New York Residence
events.description: Execution of a search warrant at Jeffrey Epstein's New York house, resulting in the seizure of electronic devices and storage media.

keyFacts: A search warrant was executed at Jeffrey Epstein's New York residence on July 11, 2019.
Approximately 38 computers/electronic storage devices and 55 CDs were seized during the search.
The taint team received fewer documents from the search than prosecutors expected.
Prosecutors sought clarification on how many seized devices were sent to and processed by the Computer Analysis and Response Team (CART).
